alert.note: Alert for Central Cook; DuPage; Eastern Will; Kane; Lake; Northern Cook; Northern Will; Southern Cook; Southern Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 31 at 7:01PM CDT until April 01 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following areas, Central Cook, DuPage, Eastern Will, Kane, Lake IL, Northern Cook, Northern Will, Southern Cook and Southern Will. * WHEN...Until Midnight CDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Underpasses may be flooded. Roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Additional thunderstorms moving into northeast Illinois may impact areas that had previously received heavy rainfall. Although storms will be moving quickly, intense rainfall rates exceeding one inch in one hour could cause renewed flooding, especially in urbanized portions of the Chicago metro area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch for flash flooding means rapid-onset flooding is possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Flash flooding is a dangerous situation. Persons with interests along area rivers, creeks, and other waterways should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central Cook; DuPage; Eastern Will; Kane; Lake; Northern Cook; Northern Will; Southern Cook; Southern Will
